title: Thornmail
body: ok so I'm bronze hence I'm amazingly average at this game so this might sound stupid but can someone explain to me how thornmail is a fair item? it feels like spending less than 3k gold makes my role pointless because i cant attack anyone with thronmail without killing myself...

replies.body:
Attack speed is countered by thorn mail
Lifesteal counters thornmail.
Attackspeed + lifesteal, thornmail wins
Lifesteal + damage, thornmail loses

Damage is moderate to thornmail.
Spells and spellvamp always beat thornmail, unless they are onhit spells or do only physical damage. 
Armor penetration beats thornmail.

> ok so I'm bronze hence I'm amazingly average at this game 

Sorry to break it to you but silver is considered average at the game

One thing that's helpful to remember is that, alongside the passive effect, Thornmail only grants one stat (+100 Armour). When you compare it with other items like Randuin's Omen, Frozen Heart, and Zz' Rot Portal (which all grant additional stats, passives and actives) you'll notice that Thornmail is most useful when playing against team compositions that rely heavily on Physical Damage and Attack Speed. If that sounds like your team then it's likely it will be difficult to defeat this champion.

In other situations, such as playing against compositions featuring two or more magic damage dealers, Thornmail becomes significantly less effective. If this is the case, which it usually should be, you as an AD can focus on your positioning and kiting in order to allow your team to slowly whittle them down. You can attack them as well but do your best to stay away from them. Tanks (or juggernauts) are usually at their strongest when they are right on top of you.
